attributes.action: Give Students More Chances If They Have Been Involved In Crimes In The Past
attributes.background: A lot of young teenagers have been involved in crime recently. But it is not their fault that they are being forced to do so. They are getting brainwashed and they still have a chance in getting a better life if the Government responds and give teenagers chances. They still have a bright future.

rejection.details: Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action. If there is a specific step that you would like the Government or Parliament to take - for example, reducing sentences for teenagers who are involved in crime for the first time - you could start a new petition explaining clearly what you would like the Government or Parliament to do.
